title: Jimmy Little
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
abstract: Aboriginal singer Jimmy Little talks about what stardom meant for a boy from the bush and the profound impact his Aboriginal heritage has had on his life and his music.
description: Aboriginal singer, Jimmy Little, was able to become a major star on the pop and country music scene at a time when Australia's indigenous people faced even more institutionalised systemic discrimination than today. In this interview, Jimmy Little talks about what stardom meant for a boy from the bush, and the profound impact that his Aboriginal heritage has had on his life, and more recently, his music.
